_readme.description: Portfolio data file. One JSON per section page. The HTML reads this file automatically via the DATA_URL variable.

fields.title: Big title shown on hero and sticky header
fields.subtitle: Small text shown below the title on load
fields.tags: Array of filter tags. Always keep 'All' as the first one.
fields.items: Array of portfolio pieces shown as tiles in the grid

item_fields.name: Title of the piece, shown on tile hover and in the viewer
item_fields.tags: Array of tags for this piece. Must match values defined in the top-level tags array
item_fields.subtitle: Small text shown only inside the viewer (e.g. engine, year)
item_fields.large: Optional. Set to true to make the tile span 2 columns
item_fields.thumb: Path to the thumbnail image shown in the grid tile
item_fields.content: Array of content blocks shown inside the viewer, in the order you define them

content_block_types.image: { type: 'image', src: 'path/to/image.jpg' }  — displays a full-width image
content_block_types.video: { type: 'video', src: 'path/to/video.mp4' }  — displays a video player
content_block_types.text: { type: 'text',  value: 'Your text here...' } — paragraph of descriptive text
content_block_types.spacer: { type: 'spacer', size: 'sm' | 'md' | 'lg' } — vertical blank space between blocks

notes: You can mix and combine as many content blocks as you want inside each item
The first image or video in content is used as thumbnail if 'thumb' is not set
Supported image formats: jpg, png, webp, gif
To create a new section page, duplicate portfolio-page.html and change DATA_URL to point to this file

content.value: Some of the materials i worked on for CAF (Chaos at Fazbear's).
Basic colored tiles (with some tiles slightly imperfect) and a variant of the same material that is decolored.
Grid material made as a test and used for blockouts.
Brick wall material, mostly used using vertex painting as a background layer.
This is a FNaF music video of 'Riddle' by 'Bad Computer' for which I was commissioned. (2021)
These are some BTS media that I luckily found for the video, since it's a 5-year-old work most of the BTS is lost media nowadays.
